result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryley Ralph Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence withheld- DE placed on 5 years probation consecutive to prison sentence in Chippewa County case #14CF59.  Fine/costs $2733.00; $6000 that was seized from DE is to be applied to fine, remaining balance to be refunded to DE and sent to him at New Lisbon Correctional.  DE must undergo cognitive thinking program, AODA assessment and any other counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by DOC agent.  


Consecutive to: prison sentence in Chippewa County case #14CF59

miscConds.notes: $2483 fine to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court, using the $6000 that was seized from the DE by the Sawyer County Sheriff's Department.  Remaining balance after paying court obligations to be returned to DE at the New Lisbon Correctional Facility.

Remaining balance after paying court obligations to be returned to DE at the New Lisbon Correctional Facility.

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Ryley Ralph Clark in court with attorney Jesse Jon Johansen.  Defendant Ryley Ralph Clark in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both attorneys and DE acknowledge receipt of the Pre-sentence investigation.  Atty Poquette reports an error on Page 24, addresses that and makes sentencing argument.  Atty Johansen makes statement, agrees with the State- Joint Recommendation.  DE makes statement.  Court addresses DE.

Court adopts agreement and Withholds Sentence: DE placed on 5 years probation consecutive to prison sentence in Chippewa County case #14CF59.  Fine/costs $2733.00; $6000 that was seized from DE is to be applied to fine, remaining balance to be refunded to DE and sent to him at New Lisbon Correctional.  DE must undergo cognitive thinking program, AODA assessment and any other counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by DOC agent.  

Attorneys do not have jail credit computed at this time, issue may need to be addressed in future.  Court states zero days credit at this time, clerk to amend JOC if credit is later found to be applicable.
